title: Missouri National Recreational River: Where To Eat
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Know Before You Come     Where To Eat              Where To Eat          Dining in and around the park offers many options, or you can opt to eat surrounded by nature at the park's picnic areas.  Outside the park, many restaurants cater to a range of tastes. National Park Service employees are prohibited from providing recommendations regarding eating establishments. For information about places to eat, please contact the:  Southeast South Dakota Tourism Association at 1-888-353-7382; Yankton Area Chamber of Commerce at 1-800-888-1460 Vermillion Area Chamber of Commerce at 1-800-809-2071 Corps of Discovery Welcome Center at 402-667-6557.     Inside the Park/Partner Sites: Picnic sites are available on park property at Mulberry Bend Overlook. Picnic tables are also available at all of our partner facilities such as Ponca State Park, Lewis and Clark Visitor Center, Lewis and Clark State Recreation Area and at several spots around Fort Randall.
